page.title: 06PUB SITES & GHOSTS
page.content: Most of the pub sites in the area are ancient.{The Griffin}(formerly{The {Magpie}) appears to be the oldest building. The{Seven Stars}(seven stars round the Virgin's crown) was built in{ {1770}and rebuilt more recently. The{Royal Oak,Bird i'th Hand}and{ {Stanley Arms}are newly built on old sites and tales of ghosts abound. People leaving{The Stanley}late at night have a good chance of seeing the {BRIDE IN WHITE}who haunted the area round{Gillars Green.}She died of a broken heart when her husband went to war centuries ago.Another ghost is that of{DAVE EARP}who killed a policeman during the last century whilst returning from a poaching trip at Knowsley Park.He was discovered in the old mineshafts and now parades round{Millfields}and{Triplex}grounds.
